record.field: Customer Service Test
general
one_page
scoring_without_answers
open
1. A customer walks into the office and asks for the deadline to file a permit application. You do not know the answer. It would be best for you to do which of the following?
simple_choice
A. Tell the person what you think the answer might be
B. Say that you are not allowed to give out that information to the public
C. Refer the person to your supervisor
D. Inform the person that you don't know but will find out
2. A person approaches you and tells you of many complaints he has about your department. You should first:
simple_choice
A. Assume that he is just blowing off steam and ignore his complaints
B. Check into the legitimacy of the complaints
C. Ask for advice from your supervisor on the best way to handle the person
D. Regard the complaints as accurate and take immediate steps to correct them
3. Assume that you are taking a telephone message from a co-worker who is not in the office at the time. Of the following, the LEAST important item to write on the message is the:
simple_choice
A. Time of the call
B. Length of the call
C. Name of the caller
D. Telephone number of the caller

4. A customer has come into your office and submitted an application. When you give her some more forms to complete, she complains about all the bureaucratic red tape that is slowing down the approval of her application. In which of the following ways should you respond to the customer?
simple_choice
A. Simply be patient with her
B. Suggest that she can contact her state legislayots if she wants to change the law
C. Tell her the reasons why your offiice needs the information
D. Say that you cannot process her application untill all the forms have been completed

5. As an administrative assistant, you have been training Mrs. W., who is not directly under your supervision. She has not appeared to be particularly competent during the month she has been in her position. You are explaining application procedures to a client when Mrs. W. interrupts to ask you a question. You tell her you are busy with a client and will come to her office when you are through. In a low voice, she begins to call you names and say bad things about the department. There are several clients in the office in addition to the one you are working with. The supervisor doesn't appear to be around. What should you do?
simple_choice
A. Ignore her and continue to assist the client
B. Ask another employee to help the client while you escort Mrs. W. to a room away from the public area
C. Get on the phone and requesr assistance from a department administrator
D. Say, “Now, Mrs. W., I said I’d be with you as soon as i could. Now please let me finish

6. You overhear your boss giving a client the name of a person to contact for some information. You know this person is no longer the one to reach for this information. The client is still in the office. What, if anything, should you do?
simple_choice
A. Give the individual the correct name, and explain that your boss was unaware of a different person responsible for providing the information
B. Do not get involved in the situation
C. Quickly take your boss aside and provide the correct name
D. Wait until the client leaves, and then provide your boss with the correct name
7. You're helping a computer illiterate friend set up his Internet connection over the phone. He is just not getting what you are trying to explain. How much time do you spend explaining it to him?
simple_choice
A. About half on hour, I’d make sure he understands at least the basics
B. I’d work with him for as long as it takes
C. 10 minutes or so, I’d go through it once as quickly as possible and then hang up
D. None at all, I’d get frustrated the first time he says, “I don’t understand”
8. A person is telling you a story but taking forever to get to the point. What do you do?
simple_choice
A. I ask him/her to get to the poin of the story
B. I interrupt by asking, “Does this story have a point?”
C. I let him/her finish the story without interrupting
D. I let him/her finish the story without interrupting, but I can’t help glancing at my watch
9. When having a disagreement, I typically:
simple_choice
A. Maintain a normal voice level
B. Lower my voice to an ominous whisper
C. Raise my voice slightly
D. Raise my voice level markedly
10. When conversing with clients who have a less extensive vocabulary (e.g., lower education level):
simple_choice
A. I may become very impatient, and it’s probably obvious
B. I adjust my speech to their level
C. I become impatient, and it may show
D. I may become impatient, but I try not to let on
11. When conversing with a person who takes forever to get to the point:
simple_choice
A. I can’t help finishing his/her sentences
B. I keep myself from finishing his/her sentences
C. I try not to finish his/her sentences but do not always succeed
D. I finish his/her sentences for him/her
12. When it comes to resolving conflicts:
simple_choice
A. I prefer “give and take”
B. I try to push for a win on my part, but I can accept a compromise if it is not in the cards
C. I usually give in and let the other person have his/her way
D. It’s my way or the highway
13. You are asked to push a particular viewpoint with a client. The request makes perfect business sense, but you do not believe in the notion you are to advocate. How do you deal with the situation?
simple_choice
A. I “pull it off” effortlessly
B. Despite the intention to go ahead wit the request, I just can’t follow through with it
C. I will make an attempt, and I will be convicing
D. I try to do my best to “pull it off”
14. Customers appreciate good manners and courtesy send a powerful message.
simple_choice
A. True
B. False
15. Which of the following are ways companies gather customer feedback?
simple_choice
A. Surveys
B. Social Media
C. Customer complaints
D. All of the answers
16. Which of the following is an example of in-person customer service?
simple_choice
A. The customer and employee are chatting online
B. The customer left a message on the company's social media page
C. Both the customer and employee are in a store
D. The employee is in the store and the customer is on the phone
17. Which of the following statements are not true of satisfied customers?
simple_choice
A. Satisfied customers tend to stay loyal
B. Customers will spend more money with a company for great customer service
C. Satisfied customers do not share their experience with other people
D. All of the above
18. When focusing on the customer you should NOT :
simple_choice
A. apologize to the customer after dealing with an interruption
B. show empathy with facial expressions and body language
C. pay attention to every distraction
D. focus on the customer's needs
19. Which of the following are NOT responsible for customer service____
simple_choice
A. Owners
B. Directors
C. Customers
D. All of the above
20. Which of the statements does not use welcoming words?
simple_choice
A. I'd be happy to help you with that
B. I don't know if that will work
C. I'm definitely able to do that
D. I'm absolutely sure
21. To listen completely to a customer, you should focus on what the customer is saying and not what you plan to say in response.
simple_choice
A. True
B. False
22. What is the definition of customer service?
simple_choice
A. The assistance provided by a company to people who buy or use its products or services
B. The assistance provided by a sales rep on the sales floor
C. The advice given between employees to help customers
D. The advice provided by a customer service rep over the phone
23. Which of the following is NOT something to which customers pay attention?
simple_choice
A. Words
B. Facial expression
C. Appearance
D. Handwriting
24. When dealing with a customer, you must ______ before coming to a conclusion.
simple_choice
A. gather as much information as possible
B. get help
C. make a decision
D. All of the above
25. Only a fraction of people who are unsatisfied actually complain.
simple_choice
A. True
B. False
26. How can stereotypes affect how you treat customers?
simple_choice
A. Stereotypes help you meet customer's need
B. Stereotypes give you the best idea of who the customer is
C. Stereotypes help you find out what the customer wants
D. Stereotypes can cause you to misjudge and mistreat customers
27. Your feelings about yourself will affect the way you deal with the customer
simple_choice
A. True
B. False
28. Which of the following help ethical behavior?
simple_choice
A. Knowing the product
B. Being honest
C. Taking responsibility
D. All of the above
29. Which of the following is NOT an example of using the right words?
simple_choice
A. Avoid slang
B. Use lots of technical terms
C. Choose words the average person will understand
D. Stay away from jargon
30. You should use a _______ and pleasant tone when speaking to a customer.
simple_choice
A. shy
B. angry
C. confident
D. calm
